sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Available from chemical supply companies; Gd (Gadolinium oxide) - Source from rare earth metal suppliers; Nd (Neodymium oxide) - Same as Gd; O (Oxygen source) - Use high-purity oxygen gas; Sr (Strontium carbonate) - Obtain from chemical suppliers.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Available from chemical supply companies; Gd (Gadolinium oxide) - Source from rare earth metal suppliers; Nd (Neodymium oxide) - Same as Gd; O (Oxygen source) - Use high-purity oxygen gas; Sr (Strontium carbonate) - Obtain from chemical suppliers.

1. Weigh all materials accurately using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry mortar and pestle, mix B, Gd, Nd, and Sr thoroughly to achieve a homogenous powder. 3. Add O gradually while mixing to ensure even distribution. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh all materials accurately using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry mortar and pestle, mix B, Gd, Nd, and Sr thoroughly to achieve a homogenous powder. 3. Add O gradually while mixing to ensure even distribution. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1000 °C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 4 hours to facilitate reaction and formation of B4Gd2Nd2O16Sr4.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1000 °C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 4 hours to facilitate reaction and formation of B4Gd2Nd2O16Sr4.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-4 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has reached a safe temperature to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-4 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has reached a safe temperature to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Inspect for any cracks or imperfections. 3. If necessary, sand the edges to achieve desired dimensions and smoothness. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear coat for protection.
